page.title: 05HOUSING-OAKERSIDE DRIVE
page.content: The building of this part of Peterlee began in the 1960's,with the majority of the houses being owned by thr Peterlee Development Coporation.Among these are rented flats, maisonettes, detached, semis and terraced houses. The architect Victor Passmore was employed to design these houses, together around open grassed and treed areas to create a countryside atmosphere.This idea was to get away from the traditional rows of colliery houses.Originally they were built with flat roofs.This proved to be a poor design and millions of pounds are being spent converting them to conventional roofs.As well as building houses for rent P.D.C. has also encouraged private firms to build in Okerside Park.Individual plots of land were also sold to allow people to build their own houses.
